interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information === Product Title: Real Techniques Bold Metals: Diamond Sponge, Create Shadow or Highlighting, Multi Surfaced for Variety of Application, Synthetic Materials, Latex Free Review Date: 2017/04/11 Store: Real Techniques Product Description: ['Real Techniques Bold Metals: Diamond Sponge, Create Shadow or Highlighting, Multi Surfaced for Variety of Application, Synthetic Materials, Latex Free'] Average Rating: 4.1 Product Details: {'Brand': 'Real Techniques', 'Color': 'Diamond', 'Material': 'Rubber', 'Item Dimensions LxWxH': '2.35 x 2 x 5.12 inches', 'Recommended Uses For Product': 'For Highlighting', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'Product Dimensions': '2.35 x 2 x 5.12 inches; 0.48 Ounces', 'Item model number': '1552', 'UPC': '079625915525', 'Manufacturer': 'Paris Presents Incorporated'} Review Text: I like this, but I don't love it. It works well, but I don't think it really stands out as a revolutionary shape or as a favorite among my sponge collection.

The feature of this sponge that I like best and used the most is the pointed tip (which has more point that is currently pictured). The point is excellent at getting into little creviced on the face.

The other sides a re a little gimmicky but usable (although I never use the smaller rectangular facets for anything!). Overall I think I prefer using their brushes with rounded sides, and I think their shape feels more natural in the hand as well. Still, I have no complaints about this one, and I really like the texture of it. The pleasant point to this one probably renders this a tie. Basically, I think you need a Real Techniques Face Sponge, but I don't think it matters which one; since the other is cheaper, I would probably go with it.

It is a very soft sponge, pleasant feeling on the skin, and it seems made from quality material. It washes clean and dries well. Review Title: Another good sponge from Real Techniques (I like their others equally well.) Rating: 4.0 --------------------------------------------------
reference_summary:
Ulta Eyeshadow Palette, Metals Ulta {'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'Package Dimensions': '8.1 x 3.5 x 0.7 inches; 5.6 Ounces', 'UPC': '717897052646'} I really like this palette, but feel it should be noted that it is NOT as expected. Very nice colors, but more subdued than bold, more satin/shimmer than metallic. This is my first Ulta palette and I am happy with the quality. I only deducted one star because the colors are somewhat other than expected. I paid $12.

I specifically bought it for the green color, and I still like the green color, but it's not as bright or as metallic as the collection name caused me to expect. The finish is something of a shimmering satin, not metallic. The colors are somewhat subdued. The package says "jewel tones" which may be more accurate than the "metals" description, but still (to me) implies more brightly colored shades, with fewer earth tones. I would also expect a "jewel toned" palette to include a strong purple, and this only has the lilac (Dynasty). (The Royal looks purple but swatched brown with a hint of burgundy.) The colors are more woodsy than jeweled. The green is more mossy than emerald, the purple more floral than jeweled, the blue more night sky than sapphire.

The quality of the shadows is good. Neither buttery nor powdery, it's a slightly dry formula that nevertheless doesn't kick up a lot of product or cause a lot of fall out. I wear them over a primer, but I have been happy with their wear time. As stated above, pigmentation is good in that you don't have to build heavily, but it's also not a bright coloring.

A lovely bonus is that I actually love the brush that comes with this item! How often do you say that about a brush in a palette? It's not only soft and usable, it's unique among my brush collection. It's flufflier and less flat that most brushes of it's size, and it's also smaller and more pinpointed that most brushes that have a bit of fluffiness to them. Overall, I feel like it gives good control while still blending well. It's quickly become a favorite brush.

There may have been a naming crisis when creating this palette, lol. As the palette name is Metals, the subtitle is Jewels, and every individual shade is named with a royalty/gentry theme. The shares are: Noble (white), Lady (pale pink), Reign (earthy pink), Crown (gold), Dynasty (lilac), Royal (brown), Honor (platinum), Jester (silver), Armor (bronze), Fortress (green), Duchess (navy), and Duke (off black). No mattes, all satin/shimmer. All smooth, no fall out, some apply more evenly than others (drier formula). Swatched dry on dry skin in photo. Will build to brighter, more shiny finish.

I ordered this palette on a whim, and I've enjoyed it. However, if you are wanted super metallic finishes or bright colors, you should manage your expectations. Lovely palette, poorly named. Real Techniques Bold Metals: Diamond Sponge, Create Shadow or Highlighting, Multi Surfaced for Variety of Application, Synthetic Materials, Latex Free Real Techniques ['Real Techniques Bold Metals: Diamond Sponge, Create Shadow or Highlighting, Multi Surfaced for Variety of Application, Synthetic Materials, Latex Free'] {'Brand': 'Real Techniques', 'Color': 'Diamond', 'Material': 'Rubber', 'Item Dimensions LxWxH': '2.35 x 2 x 5.12 inches', 'Recommended Uses For Product': 'For Highlighting', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'Product Dimensions': '2.35 x 2 x 5.12 inches; 0.48 Ounces', 'Item model number': '1552', 'UPC': '079625915525', 'Manufacturer': 'Paris Presents Incorporated'} I like this, but I don't love it. It works well, but I don't think it really stands out as a revolutionary shape or as a favorite among my sponge collection.

The feature of this sponge that I like best and used the most is the pointed tip (which has more point that is currently pictured). The point is excellent at getting into little creviced on the face.

The other sides a re a little gimmicky but usable (although I never use the smaller rectangular facets for anything!). Overall I think I prefer using their brushes with rounded sides, and I think their shape feels more natural in the hand as well. Still, I have no complaints about this one, and I really like the texture of it. The pleasant point to this one probably renders this a tie. Basically, I think you need a Real Techniques Face Sponge, but I don't think it matters which one; since the other is cheaper, I would probably go with it.

It is a very soft sponge, pleasant feeling on the skin, and it seems made from quality material. It washes clean and dries well. Another good sponge from Real Techniques (I like their others equally well.)
profile:
**Updated User Profile Summary:**

- **Preference for Subdued Colors:** The user enjoys eyeshadow palettes with muted, earthy tones, leaning toward jewel tones in subdued versions.

- **Quality Over Boldness:** They prioritize quality in product formulation, valuing texture and wear time over bright pigmentation. They prefer products that blend well without excessive fallout.

- **Specific Color Expectations:** The user expresses disappointment when colors do not meet expectations, favoring subdued shades, particularly in the green and jewel tone families.

- **Accessory Appreciation:** They appreciate effectively designed tools accompanying makeup products, indicating satisfaction with the functionality and feel of makeup applicators.

- **Analytical Reviews:** Their reviews reflect a critical and analytical approach, emphasizing product details and consistency in performance, often scrutinizing marketing claims.

- **Mixed Feelings About Expectations:** The user acknowledges discrepancies between product names and actual performance, indicating a desire for clarity in product descriptions.

- **General Applicator Preferences:** Recently, the user tried a makeup sponge that they found satisfactory but not groundbreaking, preferring traditional brushes for their application style. They appreciate high-quality materials and effective usability in all tools. 

Overall, the user seeks high-quality, subdued eye makeup products and effective applicators that align with their aesthetic preferences and analytical evaluation standards.
